metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2179 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in config.c inconfig.cgi in (1) Nagios 3.2.3 and (2) Icinga before 1.4.1 allow remoteattackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the expand parameter,as demonstrated by an (a) command action or a (b) hosts action.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nagios3 - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-cgi - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-common - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-core - 3.2.3-3
No subscription required

icinga - 1.10.3-1
icinga-cgi - 1.10.3-1
icinga-common - 1.10.3-1
icinga-core - 1.10.3-1
icinga-idoutils - 1.10.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nagios3 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.3-3').
icinga package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-1').
